interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: District B13/District 13: Ultimatum 2-Pack Review Date: 2012/03/10 Store: Cyril Raffaelli (Actor), David Belle (Actor), Patrick Alessandrin (Director), Pierre Morel (Director) & 1 more Rated: R Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ["Includes: District B13 Paris, 2010. An isolation wall surrounds the ghetto cities of District B13. Within these walls, without effective law enforcement, gang rule is absolute. Damien is a member of an elite police squadron, highly trained in martial arts. He goes undercover to infiltrate a gang in order to defuse a neutron bomb and save District B13 from annihilation. Damien recruits the help of a criminal named Leito - whose only goal is to save his sister from the clutches of the same gang. District 13: Ultimatum Two years have passed since elite police officer Damien Tomasso (Cyril Raffaelli) teamed up with reformed vigilante Leito (David Belle) to save the notorious District 13, a racially charged ghetto populated by violent drug dealing gangs and vicious killers. Despite government promises to maintain order, the state of the district has deteriorated and is causing civil unrest. A group of corrupt cops and elected officials conspire to cash in on the redevelopment of the district by proposing it's destruction under the nuclear air strike. Damien and Leito must join forces again, using their martial arts and unique physical skills, to bring peace to the neighborhood by any means necessary."] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MGNO10299BR', 'Director': 'Patrick Alessandrin, Pierre Morel', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '3 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 27, 2010', 'Actors': 'Cyril Raffaelli, David Belle, Philippe Torreton, Daniel Duval, Elodie Yung', 'Dubbed': 'English', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Magnolia Home Ent', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: Yes, I do mean that: these are among the best action movies ever made -- but I'll qualify by adding "which involve humans doing athletic things", such as martial arts movies. (I like the other kinds too, BTW.)

But if you enjoy watching incredibly gifted athletes doing great stunts done in a very believable way, and don't mind preposterous plots, then these movies might tickle your fancy. Just being able to watch David Belle (said to be the founder of parkour/parcour) is worth the price in my opinion.

So remember, don't expect any Profound Commentary on the Human Condition (thank goodness). Don't get too hung up on the silliness or the stereotypes, that's part of the fun. Just relax and enjoy great escapist fun with a good companion or two. Review Title: silly plots, but among the best action movies ever made Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Rio Bravo John Wayne (Actor), Dean Martin (Actor), Howard Hawks (Director) & 0 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles ['Rio Bravo (Widescreen) (Sous-titres français)'] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Howard Hawks', 'Media Format': 'Anamorphic, Color, DVD, Subtitled, Widescreen, Closed-captioned, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 21 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 8, 2001', 'Actors': 'John Wayne, Dean Martin, Ricky Nelson, Angie Dickinson, Walter Brennan', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French, Portuguese', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0), Unqualified (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Writers': 'B.H. McCampbell, Jules Furthman, Leigh Brackett', 'Number of discs': '1'} I first saw this movie in the early 60s, when I was a young kid, and it stayed in my mind. It's that good. I recently saw it with my 11 year old son, and he just loved it; this boy normally won't watch westerns. It's that good.

John Wayne, Dean Martin, Walter Brennan all do a great job. Even Rick Nelson, not someone you'd expect to see in a western, does a solid job. Angie Dickinson is very likable. It all hangs together, and doesn't work too hard at it; just goes down nice and easy. (Ok, I mixed my metaphors, but you get the drift.)

What can I say, I love this movie! If you like the classic ones, buy it, it's worth every penny. if you like the classic westerns, this is a must-see, must-own District B13/District 13: Ultimatum 2-Pack Cyril Raffaelli (Actor), David Belle (Actor), Patrick Alessandrin (Director), Pierre Morel (Director) & 1 more Rated: R Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies ["Includes: District B13 Paris, 2010. Despite government promises to maintain order, the state of the district has deteriorated and is causing civil unrest. A group of corrupt cops and elected officials conspire to cash in on the redevelopment of the district by proposing it's destruction under the nuclear air strike. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preference**: Strong affinity for classic western films, particularly those featuring iconic actors, coupled with an emerging interest in high-energy action films, especially martial arts and parkour features.
- **Influence of Nostalgia**: Values movies that evoke childhood memories and experiences shared with family, continuously seeking films enjoyable for both adults and children.
- **Recommendation Tendencies**: Likely to recommend titles highly rated by themselves; this extends to action films as well, especially those showcasing athleticism and stunts.
- **Rating Behavior**: Demonstrates a tendency to provide high ratings for films with personal resonance or entertainment value, indicating a positive bias towards films evoking emotional connections, regardless of genre.
- **Family Engagement**: Shows interest in films that can be appreciated across generations, seeking enjoyable viewing experiences for varied age groups.
- **Review Style**: Appreciates storytelling elements and character performances while enjoying films that provide escapism and fun, even if the plots are simplistic or silly. This indicates a broader preference for light-hearted entertainment alongside classic narratives.

Overall, this user maintains a strong focus on nostalgic classic cinema, particularly westerns, while displaying a newfound enthusiasm for dynamic action films that emphasize athletic prowess and entertainment value. They are likely to continue engaging with films that reflect these diverse interests.
